title: Johnnie Lee Higgins
text:
Johnnie Lee Higgins (born September 8, 1983) is a former professional <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a>. Higgins played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="University%20of%20Texas%20at%20El%20Paso">University of Texas at El Paso</a>. He was drafted by the <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a> in the third round (99th pick overally) in the <a href="2007%20NFL%20Draft">2007 NFL Draft</a>, and has also played for the <a href="Philadelphia%20Eagles">Philadelphia Eagles</a>.
Early years.
Higgins was born and raised in Sweeny and attended <a href="Sweeny%20High%20School%20%28Texas%29">Sweeny High School</a> in <a href="Sweeny%2C%20Texas">Sweeny, Texas</a>, and was a student and a <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a>, <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, and <a href="Track%20and%20field">track</a>. In <a href="high%20school%20basketball">basketball</a>, he was named his team's <a href="Most%20Valuable%20Player">Most Valuable Player</a>.
College career.
Higgins attended the <a href="University%20of%20Texas%20at%20El%20Paso">University of Texas at El Paso</a> to play <a href="College%20football">football</a> for the <a href="UTEP%20Miners%20football">Miners</a>. He received several honors, including <a href="Conference%20USA">Conference USA</a> <a href="Special%20Teams">Special Teams</a> Player of the Year in 2006.
Professional career.
Oakland Raiders.
After turning in a 4.43 <a href="40-yard%20dash">40-yard dash</a> time at the 2007 <a href="NFL%20Scouting%20Combine">NFL Scouting Combine</a>, Higgins was selected by the <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a> in the third round (99th overall and the final pick of the first day) of the <a href="2007%20NFL%20Draft">2007 NFL Draft</a>. He became the team's starting <a href="punt%20returner">punt returner</a> and he returned a punt 90 yards for a touchdown in a preseason game against the <a href="Seattle%20Seahawks">Seattle Seahawks</a> on August 30, 2007. He saw action in all 16 games in the <a href="2007%20NFL%20season">2007 season</a>, starting in two of them at wide receiver.
He saw punt return action in the first three games, but it was in week 4 against the <a href="Denver%20Broncos">Denver Broncos</a> in which Higgins made his first NFL reception. He caught two passes for 14 yards in the game. On special teams, Higgins recorded five tackles. In his final game of the season, he had a punt return for 54 yards, which set up fellow rookie <a href="JaMarcus%20Russell">JaMarcus Russell</a> to throw his second touchdown of the season. Higgins finished his rookie year with six receptions for 47 yards, 20 punt returns for 103 yards, and five special teams tackles.
In the 2008 season, Higgins recorded more receiving yards than any other Raider wide receiver (tight end <a href="Zach%20Miller%20%28tight%20end%2C%20born%201985%29">Zach Miller</a> led the team in yards). He also returned punts for touchdowns in back-to-back games.
In the first game of the 2009 season, against <a href="San%20Diego%20Chargers">San Diego</a>, Higgins ran the ball one time for 19 yards.
Philadelphia Eagles.
Higgins signed a one-year contract with the <a href="Philadelphia%20Eagles">Philadelphia Eagles</a> on July 29, 2011.
He was released by the team on September 3 during final roster cuts.
Personal.
He is the cousin of <a href="NFL">NFL</a> <a href="cornerback">cornerback</a> <a href="Quentin%20Jammer">Quentin Jammer</a>.
